title: Prepare Ingredients
definition: Gather all necessary ingredients: guanciale (or pancetta/bacon), eggs, cheese (Pecorino Romano and/or Parmigiano-Reggiano), black pepper, and pasta. Measure and prepare the quantities needed, such as grating the cheese, and separating egg yolks if required.

title: Cook Guanciale
definition: Cut the guanciale into chunks or strips. Start cooking it in a cold pan over medium heat to render out the fat. Cook until it is golden and crispy but not too crispy. Optionally, remove excess fat if desired.

title: Boil Pasta
definition: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add your pasta (spaghetti is traditional) and cook until al dente, according to the package instructions. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.

title: Prepare Egg and Cheese Mixture
definition: In a bowl, whisk together eggs and grated cheese. Add a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper. Optionally, temper the egg mixture by adding a small amount of pasta water to it.

title: Combine Pasta and Guanciale
definition: Transfer the cooked pasta directly from the pot to the pan with the cooked guanciale. Turn off the heat and mix to coat the pasta with the rendered fat.

title: Add Egg Mixture
definition: Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the hot pasta and guanciale. Quickly and continuously toss or stir the pasta to create a creamy sauce without scrambling the eggs. If necessary, add reserved pasta water to achieve the desired consistency.

title: Serve
definition: Plate the pasta and garnish with additional grated cheese, freshly ground black pepper, and any reserved crispy guanciale. Serve immediately while hot and creamy.
